definition[0]: a record of how many goods or services a company has been asked to provide, which shows how successful it is financially
example[0]: Our order books are full at the moment.
definition[1]: a book listing all the orders for goods or services a company has received; also used to talk about the orders themselves
example[1]: The company said its order book now lists 742 planes.
example[2]: It’s not the only business that can’t keep its order books filled.
